definition: a headlong rush of people on a common impulse, run away in a stampede
details:
noun
- a headlong rush of people on a common impulse
= example: a headlong rush of people on a common impulse
- a wild headlong rush of frightened animals (horses or cattle)
verb
- run away in a stampede
- cause to run in panic
= example: cause to run in panic
- act, usually en masse, hurriedly or on an impulse
= example: act, usually en masse, hurriedly or on an impulse
- cause a group or mass of people to act on an impulse or hurriedly and impulsively
= example: cause a group or mass of people to act on an impulse or hurriedly and impulsively
